title: City of Tulsa ‚Äì Mental Health Support Navigator
meta.title: City of Tulsa ‚Äì Mental Health Support Navigator (MVP)
subtitle: This tool is a guide to connect you with the support that meets your needs. Please answer a few questions (no personal information is stored).
banner.label: Emergency contacts banner
banner.emergencyHtml: If this is a medical emergency or there is imminent danger to yourself or others, call 911. If you are in a mental health crisis:
banner.emergencyPrefix: If this is a <mark>medical emergency</mark> or there is imminent danger to yourself or others, call 911.
banner.mentalCrisisLabel: If you are in a mental health crisis:
A.question: A. Is anyone in immediate danger, or is this a medical emergency?
emergency.title: üö® This tool is not for emergencies. Please use the contacts below.
emergency.footer: Based on standard medical safety guidance.
emergency.crisisExplainer: 988 is the nationwide Suicide & Crisis Lifeline. Available 24/7, free and confidential.
emergency.copesExplain: COPES (Community Outreach Psychiatric Emergency Services) is Tulsa's mobile crisis response team. Trained professionals can come to you.
emergency.copesWhatIsBody: COPES (Community Outreach Psychiatric Emergency Services) is a free, confidential 24/7 crisis line and mobile response team serving adults and children in Tulsa County. You can call to talk with trained mental-health professionals, and if needed, a mobile team can come to your location (home, school, work, or community) to help stabilize the situation and connect you to follow-up care.
emergency.copesWhatIsList2: Phone counseling and mobile crisis response
emergency.copesWhatIsList3: Helps avoid unnecessary hospitalization when safe
B.question: B. Is the person needing help 18 or older?
youth.title: 24-hour support for youth
youth.yesTulsaDesc: Provides immediate crisis response, assessment, stabilization, and coordination referral for families and youth ages 5‚Äì17 years old, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
youth.calmDesc: The CALM Center is a safe and caring place for youth ages 10‚Äì17 to receive immediate support, assessment and stabilization for an emotional, behavioral or substance abuse crisis.
youth.note: For minors, it is appropriate to connect directly with specialized youth services above instead of adult clinics.
C.question: C. Are you in crisis and need to talk to someone immediately?
C.no: No (I want to calmly look for options)
adultCrisis.title: 24-hour crisis options (Adults)
adultCrisis.copes.subtitle: 24-hour phone counseling and mobile crisis response in Tulsa County if needed
adultCrisis.urc.subtitle: No appointment needed. Helpful if you want to leave your current environment and receive in-person support.
adultCrisis.urc.visitBtnTitle: Facility location link will be set at implementation
D.question: D. What is the main reason you are seeking help today? (Select all that apply)
D.options.detox: I want to safely stop using drugs or alcohol (detox)
D.options.psychosis: I am experiencing hallucinations or severe confusion
highcare.title: Urgent medical evaluation recommended
highcare.body: Based on your selections, outpatient clinics may not be appropriate. Please contact one of the following immediately:
highcare.er: Go to a hospital emergency room (ER)
highcare.erDesc: If you prefer in-person evaluation, go to your nearest ER.
routine.title: Connection to routine outpatient services (Adults)
routine.body: The following agencies provide routine outpatient care such as counseling, medication management, and SUD support.
routine.crs.modalBody:
If you are an adult seeking counseling/therapy or help with psychiatric medication (medication management), Counseling & Recovery Services of Oklahoma (CRSOK) ‚Äî a nonprofit behavioral/mental health center based in Tulsa, Oklahoma ‚Äî is a strong option.

CRSOK provides adult services including mental health assessment, individual and group counseling, and medication management by psychiatrists and pharmacists.

They accept Medicaid, Medicare, and private insurance, and financial assistance based on your circumstances is available.

If this is a crisis (for example, suicidal thoughts, severe confusion/hallucinations, or acute danger), please use the Emergency/Crisis page instead. If you want routine counseling plus medication support as an adult, start with CRSOK‚Äôs adult services overview.
routine.crs.name: CRS (Counseling & Recovery Services)
routine.crs.desc: Nonprofit based in Tulsa, OK. Provides mental health care, counseling, substance use treatment, and crisis response services.
routine.crs.applyTitle: Appointment form link will be set at implementation
routine.fcs.name: FCS (Family & Children‚Äôs Services)
routine.fcs.desc: Comprehensive behavioral-health services for adults, youth and families in the Tulsa area, including outpatient counseling, medication management, integrated healthcare and crisis stabilization.
routine.chc.name: CHC (Community Health Connection)
routine.chc.desc: Adult-friendly Federally Qualified Health Center (FQHC) in northeast Oklahoma offering primary care, dental, behavioral-health counseling and medication services (via on-site pharmacy), with sliding-fee option for uninsured.
reassure.title: Cost, language, and privacy
reassure.subtitle: You are not alone. Support is available regardless of insurance status or ability to pay. Many services are free or offered on a sliding scale based on income.
reassure.lang: Language: English and Spanish available. Free interpreters can be arranged for other languages. Please state your preferred language when contacting.
reassure.immigration: Immigration status: Proof of citizenship is not required for crisis services. Your privacy will be protected.
faq.title: FAQ
faq.cost.a: Crisis services are free. For routine care, sliding scale discounts based on income are available. Cost should not be a barrier.
faq.address.q: Do I need a fixed address?
faq.address.a: Services are available even if you are homeless. A fixed address is not required.
faq.privacy.q: Will my information be kept confidential?
faq.privacy.a: Services are confidential and information is protected by law. Except where harm is imminent, no information will be shared without your written consent.
faq.footer: Disclaimer: This tool is not for emergencies. In an emergency, call 911 / 988 / COPES directly. Note that service availability is limited to Tulsa County and surrounding areas.
